snippet: One candidate, Abdullah Abdullah, rejected the tentative results, and some of his powerful supporters talked of forming a breakaway government.
abstract: Preliminary Afghan presidential runoff results are rejected by candidate Abdullah Abdullah, leading some of his most powerful supporters to call for protests and even formation of a breakaway government; results showed Abdullah's rival Ashraf Ghani with roughly a million votes ahead.

byline.original: By MATTHEW ROSENBERG and AZAM AHMED
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Haris Kakar, Jawad Sukhanyar and Ahmad Shakib from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: One candidate, Abdullah Abdullah, rejected the tentative results, and some of his powerful supporters talked of forming a breakaway government.

headline.main: Tentative Results in Afghan Presidential Runoff Spark Protests
headline.print_headline: Tentative Results in Afghan Presidential Runoff Spark Protests
